Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322

Class EmailAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322.EmailAddress
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupEmailAddress
    public class EmailAddress
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an Internet email address using the syntax of RFC 5322. Typical address syntax is of the form "user@host.domain" or "Personal Name <user@host.domain>".
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 5322

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmailAddress

        public EmailAddress​(java.lang.String displayName,
                    java.lang.String localPart,
                    java.lang.String domain,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> comments)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        displayName - the human-readable display name for the address. May be null
        localPart - the local-part of the mailbox (before the '@'). Cannot be null
        domain - the domain of the mailbox (after the '@'). Cannot be null
        comments - any comments discovered while parsing. May be null

      • EmailAddress

        public EmailAddress​(java.lang.String displayName,
                    java.lang.String localPart,
                    java.lang.String domain,
                    boolean simpleAddress)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        displayName - the human-readable display name for the address. May be null
        localPart - the local-part of the mailbox (before the '@'). Cannot be null
        domain - the domain of the mailbox (after the '@'). Cannot be null
        simpleAddress - if there was only an address with no angle brackets

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns the display name for this address. This is an optional human-readable name for the address. It is not used for delivery.
        Returns:
        the display name, or null if not present

      • getLocalPart

        public java.lang.String getLocalPart()
        Returns the local-part of the mailbox address (the part before the '@').
        Returns:
        the local-part

      • getDomain

        public java.lang.String getDomain()
        Returns the domain of the mailbox address (the part after the '@').
        Returns:
        the domain

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns the full mailbox address in the form local-part@domain. This is a convenience method that combines localPart and domain.
        Returns:
        the mailbox address for delivering the mail

      • getEnvelopeAddress

        public java.lang.String getEnvelopeAddress()
        Returns the envelope address suitable for SMTP protocol use.

        This returns just local-part@domain without any display name, angle brackets, or comments. This is the format required for SMTP envelope addresses in MAIL FROM and RCPT TO commands (RFC 5321).

        This method is an alias for getAddress() but with a name that clearly indicates its purpose for SMTP envelope serialization. Always use this method instead of toString() when constructing SMTP protocol messages.

        Returns:
        the envelope address in local-part@domain format

      • getComments

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getComments()
        Returns comments associated with this address, if any. These are generally ignorable.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of comments, or null if none

      • isSimpleAddress

        public boolean isSimpleAddress()
        Indicates whether this is a simple address in the legacy format.
        Returns:
        true if the original address was in the legacy format without angle brackets
